intro: Lannea chevalieri, commonly known as the African kersting's tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, featuring a broad, spreading crown and thick, leathery leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while the fruit is a woody drupe that splits open to release seeds. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
